# NIAlgorithmConvergenceStatus.Reason

**Structure**

The possible reasons for the Camera Assistance status.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Reason
```

## Overview

When the app enables Camera Assistance by setting [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NINearbyPeerConfiguration/isCameraAssistanceEnabled] to `true`, the framework provides the app with one or more reasons when the convergence status is [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NIAlgorithmConvergenceStatus-2fnve/notConverged(_:)]. The reasons detail specific user actions the framework requires to improve the results of Camera Assistance.

At runtime, the app needs to check the status in the `convergence` object provided by [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didUpdateAlgorithmConvergence:for:)]. If the status indicates that Camera Assistance requires user intervention, the app needs to coach the user, such as by presenting text that explains what to do for each circumstance that [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NIAlgorithmConvergence/reasons] can describe.



## Comparing convergence status reasons

- **localizedDescription**: A string that contains a description of the error.

## Interpreting the convergence status reason

- **insufficientMovement**: Indicates that the device needs to move from its current position in the physical environment.
- **insufficientHorizontalSweep**: Indicates that the device needs more horizontal motion.
- **insufficientVerticalSweep**: Indicates that the device needs more vertical motion.
- **insufficientLighting**: Indicates that the camera needs to view the physical environment under better lighting conditions.
- **insufficientSignalStrength**: Indicates that the users might be too far apart.
